todaysEvents.summary: US-Israeli joint strikes on Iran (Feb 28) killed Supreme Leader Khamenei; Strait of Hormuz declared de facto war zone — LNG and crude transit effectively halted as of Mar 1
Malaysia PM Anwar tables emergency Parliament motion condemning strikes as 'barbaric'; Indonesia's Prabowo offers personal mediation — Iran embassy Jakarta responds 'we're ready to talk' (Mar 1)
Philippines DOE Secretary Garin: 'The price will really go up. I will not sugarcoat.' 30-day mandatory oil stockpile activated; emergency meetings called with oil companies (Mar 2)

scenarios.label: Base
scenarios.description: Hormuz disruption lasts 2–4 weeks; Iran successor government enters ceasefire talks. Brent stabilises at $78–85/bbl with sustained risk premium. ASEAN LNG buyers scramble for spot cargoes; JKM peaks near $18/MMBtu. SCS tensions remain elevated but secondary to the Iran shock. Goldman Q4 2026 normalisation forecast at $60/bbl contingent on swift resolution.

scenarios.label: Stress
scenarios.description: Hormuz closure extends 1–3 months; Iran proxy forces activate across Gulf. Brent surges toward $100/bbl (BloombergNEF $91 target). JKM LNG spikes to ~$25/MMBtu — worst gas market disruption since Russia-Ukraine 2022. ASEAN current account deficits widen sharply; PHP and THB most vulnerable. Bank Indonesia forced into emergency intervention as IDR breaches historic lows.

scenarios.label: Tail
scenarios.description: Full Hormuz closure sustained beyond 3 months simultaneously with SCS kinetic escalation. Oil at $150–200/bbl (J.P. Morgan upper bound). LNG effectively unavailable for spot buyers; Qatar's 77 mtpa offline. Recession probability >70% for Thailand and Philippines. ASEAN EM bonds face mass outflows; 1970s-style energy shock across the region.
